intro: Epidendrum tenellum, commonly known as the small green orchid, is a species of orchid native to Central and South America. It is a terrestrial orchid that typically grows in shaded, humid environments. The plant has slender, hairy stems and produces small, greenish-white flowers that are often clustered together. Its leaves are elliptical and arranged in a rosette pattern, contributing to its compact appearance. Epidendrum tenellum is valued for its ornamental appeal and is relatively easy to cultivate in suitable conditions.
